title: Emerging Market Selection Framework
summary: A systematic approach to identifying emerging real estate markets before they become mainstream, focusing on economic indicators, population trends, and supply-demand dynamics that signal growth potential.
key_points: Focus on job growth as the primary indicator of future housing demand
Look for population growth trends, especially in-migration from other areas
Analyze rent growth rates compared to national averages
Evaluate supply constraints like geographic limitations or zoning restrictions
Consider business-friendly environments with lower taxes and regulations
Examine infrastructure improvements that may trigger neighborhood revitalization
examples: Secondary markets with strong job creation in healthcare, technology, or manufacturing sectors
Areas with new transportation infrastructure that improves accessibility
Neighborhoods adjacent to gentrifying areas showing early signs of spillover effects

source.chapter: Chapter 3: Finding the Next Hot Market
